reviews_data.review_text: Love the tartine with bacon, brie, and fig jam! Also, the ice tea with lavender syrup. Really tasty food and desserts.

On the way back to Soda City, my beautiful Daughter in Law asked if there were any French Bakeries nearby. (She speaks fluent French) So I whooped out my brain, iPhone, and did an extensive research. I came up with Am√©lies French Bakery that had a location near us and several others in Charlotte. I GPS'd to their Carmel location and put the emergency blinkers on as I waited outside while the crew were inside filling up boxes. When they came, I took pictures that looked pretty good. Little did I know my tongue hitting my head may cause a concussion when I took a taste of the first sample and I thought I was in France as they were so good!!! If you are looking for sickening sweet desserts, this is not for you. If you like European sweetness, Soda City can't compete!!! I knew something was up as I saw so many people coming out with boxes!!! The only error was my Son told them not to torch the top of his cream br√ªl√©e. He said he wouldn't turn it down again.

Amelie's French bakery, this is one of the most popular bakery in Charlotte, every time I come here always a line, my favorite is the macaroons! Not too sweet and very soft. Love the spacious seating area. Bring a friend and enjoy your French style morning!

I really love Am√©lie's because of the funky vibe, and the food is decent. But ugh the staff. They're nice, but they never listen to you. Here's a typical order for me:  Hi! What can I get for you?  Large oat milk hot latte, please!  Anything else?  No, thank you.  OK, regular hot latte. Is that for here or to go?  Umm, no. Large, please. And oat milk. And it's for here. Mug, please.  Gotcha! Can I get a name?  Christopher.  Right. Anything else?  Umm‚Ä¶no, thank you [again].  Got it!  And what was the name for that order?  Christopher. ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è  Five minutes later: ‚ÄúLatte for Chris!‚Äù (and of course it's in a to go cup).  ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è  It's like this more times than it's not.  Train your staff to LISTEN. It's so disrespectful.

Great coffee, sandwiches & pastries. The only caviat is I was there when it was very busy...they made my coffee while I was at the register completing my payment...ny the time I picked it up-it had cooled off too much.  When my sandwich came to the table it was only semi-warm. Everythimg was delicious.
i've been coming here for years! it's a beautiful and unique place. today i tried a s'mores entremet and was stunned by how good it was! they have various pastries and also a coffee and wine bar!
Great pastries and coffee!

(Translated by Google) Cozy place, delicious cappuccino. There are delicious pastries.  (Original) –£—é—Ç–Ω–æ–µ –º–µ—Å—Ç–æ ,–≤–∫—É—Å–Ω–æ–µ –∫–∞–ø—É—á–∏–Ω–æ . –ï—Å—Ç—å –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –≤–∫—É—Å–Ω—ã–µ –ø–∏—Ä–æ–∂–Ω—ã–µ.

I liked the food here and it is pretty cool inside to be honest. Also the lady at the counter did everything possible to help us  with our order since we were here for the first time. I didn't give five stars only because we did wait 25 minutes for our order to be done and it was served in paper bowls and plastic containers - I'm not sure they always do that

I am speechless.  For years Amelie's was THE place to get a great baguette.  I would buy 10 at a time since I live a long way from  the closest store. I was close by yesterday and had some friends coming to breakfast today so I drove to the store and bought one so I could serve something special. Baguette now is almost like plain white loaf bread made in the shape of a baguette.  Only special as to how disappointing to see how ordinary it is. LaBrea baguettes at HT much better, Bobby Boy Bakeshop in Winston Salem are the best I've tasted on this side of the Atlantic. Amelie, bring back the old baguette.
The french dip was very good.
A good advise: when you get a to-go order for 2 or more different drinks, please mark or label them all the time.
Great ambiance and plenty of comfortable seating. Good coffee and food options too!

Great place yo grab coffee and meet.  Update 11/06/22. Today I had a coffee with a good friend around 10am.  We both decided to use the bathroom before we left the place.  Well, let me tell you: we saw an employee walk in do #1, #2, and n#3. She came out after us.  My friend and I were using each one a sink to wash out hands.  This girl wasn't happy she had to wait, so she just grabbed a paper towel to clean her hands dry; no water no soap,no sanitizer.  We ran out of the bathroom after her to see what was she will do.  To our surprise she went back to  rolling and cutting dough without gloves and no washing her hands.  This is totally unacceptable.  If you work in a restaurant take your time to wash your hands. Specifically if you are touching the food I am going to eat. Else, quit your job if you don't like it.

This is a great caf√©! The mocha latte was perfect. It seems they may be using a bakery chocolate. It had a velvety smooth mouth feel and stayed mixed to the end. Not too sweet and it let the coffee shine through. The macrons are really tasty with a variety of flavors. A slightly resistant outer crust with a delightful soft chew to the interior. And the cream is delicious. Not inexpensive by any means, but true to the old saying, "you get what you pay for." Highly recommended!
Eclectic adorable coffee shop. Delicious pastries and coffee.
Beautiful place.

I visit this location of Amelie"s about once a month. Having lived in Bordeaux some years ago as an expatriot, I miss the French pasteries from time to time, and Amelie's satisfies that longing.  On this visit, my order was a few specialties for take home which included the plain croissants (authentic in my view!), eclairs, lemon macarons, and a chocolate mousse (fluffy and tastful). Ordering has been streamlined - on reaching the head of the line, there is an associate there at all times to take your order at left of the counter. If you are ordering pastries to go, another associate works with you to complete your order. The wait was short at 5 min considering there were 12 people in line and it was a busy Sunday. Service was friendly and attentive. In a future visit, plans are to dine here which can be indoors or on the covered patio on the right side of the cafe.
Best bakery in Charlotte metro area
Thanks to my barista lady Marsta (sorry for the misspelling) for making my son and I our favorite drink "Caramel dirty chai" she's always great!

The quality of the food isn't what it used to be. My wife and I always come to Amelies for brunch and a some homework (we're both full time students), and I always order the same thing. A classic French dip. Every time I come, my French dip is ice cold in the middle. I always have to ask them to heat it. I'll even ask them when I place the order to please make sure that is heated all the way through. It still comes out cold. Last time I was here, the manager was nice enough to replace my meal and refunded the French dip. I came back again and still the same cold sandwich. I didn't say anything this time because what's the point? I dont want my money back, just some hot food. I'll just have to take the extra couple of minutes and drive to the Noda location.

I really enjoy coming to this place. I come here every Saturday morning for a great cappuccino, a mini chocolate mousse cup, and a nice breakfast.  The staff are all friendly, and the place is always clean.  I definitely recommend this place for good coffee and good eats.

I love their food but the birthday cake I picked up yesterday was a big disappointment. It was a chocolate Tuxedo cake, but it was very dry. Also, it didn't have ganache or mousse on the inside--just frosted between layers with the same frosting. There were no chocolate curls, instead little mini chocolate chips which kept rolling of the plate.  I've had good cakes from this location before, so I expected a lot more. It needed the mousse to offset the bitter dark chocolate taste. It crumbled when cut into. NO one finished their piece. Sad.
Great French bakery and cafe, Love the ambience.

I wrote a good review last year, but I have to agree with another reviewer who said that the offerings and quality on some of the bakery items have dwindled.  Like her,  I also visited about three months ago, and a few times since then, and the cases were practically empty.  I asked the employee if they sold out because of the holiday.  I was told that they were in the process of hiring three more bakers.  Lately, the cases seem to have a few more items than in the recent past.  It's not uncommon for me to take home an Amelie's shopping bag filled with boxes of pastries. However, the last two times I purchased the Strawberry Petit Gateaux, there was no cream filling!  The chantilly cream is the best part, but it was cake on top of cake!  TWICE!!! And I have to mention that the first time, the cake was dry.  Also, although the Mirror tart is delicious, it used to be so pretty with the swirl of chocolate ganache on top.  Now, the ganache is just spread on top and looks very plain.  I had lunch with my son there also, and we were both looking forward to having the Asparagus and Leek soup.  I told my son that it looked like they forgot to add the cream, and there was no flavor, as if they added unsalted broth and forgot the seasonings. The sandwiches on the croissants were good, though.  I have great memories of visiting the Flagship store in NoDa. That's where I was introduced to all the good food and pastries. The Carmel Commons location is closer to home for now.  I hope they can replicate the quality of the flagship store one day!
Awesome coffee and pastries
Strawberry Cheesecake Tart
I've been to the Carmel Rd location three times. The food is great but the coffee has always been lukewarm even before my adding milk. If i go back, I will return the coffee.

Very nice French bakery with tons of yummy cakes and meals! They are opening new locations often and all have really lovely ambiance!! Feels like Alice in Wonderland in Paris! Also have a rewards system if you sign up with your phone number or email, it helps especially for people out of town that may buy more than one thing per person like us.

(Translated by Google) A captivating place, it's like feeling the magic of Europe here. The employees are always very friendly and smiling, without a doubt one of my favorite places in Charlotte. All delicious food.  (Original) Un lugar cautivador, es c√≥mo sentir la magia de Europa aqu√≠.Los empleados muy amables y sonrientes siempre, sin duda uno de mis lugares favoritos en Charlotte . Toda la comida deliciosa .
Great eclairs
Always the best coffee (and pastries ü§´)

This was our first time visiting. We enjoyed the ambiance of the establishment and the pastries, for the most part. The petit strawberry shortcake was delicious, but the cinnamon buns were extremely dry and we could not eat them. We will try microwaving later on. Thank you!

Their pastires are really small for the price, and some of them like the eclairs are overcooked. They close to early, the should stay open on the weekday until at least 10. There's no where to hang out in Pineville where it's not a bar environment. But other thank that, the place is great. Love going there for our meetings, meet-ups.  Occasional sweet tooth. Just to get out of the house and relax. I wish they would have installed some sound proof panels or something, it gets loud when it's packed. I like going there when it's quieter.  Love their loose leaf tea options. Hard to find good tea around here if it's not a tea shop.

Camden was AMAZING! Her customer service skills are phenomenal! She took the time to answer  ALL my questions and made sure I was very happy with my selections. 10 out 10, will highly recommend!!!! I will be a repeat customer because of her. This was my first experience trying this bakery and I am so very glad I did!

Any chance I get to meet someone for coffee in South Charlotte, Amelie's is my go-to! I could ooh and ahh over all the gorgeous pasties and treats in the displays forever. I try to select something new each time and ALWAYS end up taking something home. It's such a fun experience!
I LOVE this place! High ceiling, plenty of space, funky, French inspired decor, perfect for peaceful work or casual chat... and amazing macarons.. je suis au paradis!

3rd time i have gone in and been disappointed.  1st time the case was barely full of any food in the afternoon and sandwich was cold. 2nd time waited 45 minutes for an unheated baguette, full kitchen staff and only 6 customers in the store at the time until a manager noticed that we had been waiting for a long time. And 3rd time this morning where i asked 3 girls at the registers if they could break big bills and was told yes, they took the money and then i had to wait  15 for a manager to get change and then was told  by the manager that they dont accept big bills until after lunchtime which doesnt cater to early bird customers. Unfortunately i wanted to make this a daily stop in the mornings but now i will not be stopping in at the location again.

Beautiful place. Wonderful atmosphere. Not for the gluten sensitive. Great croissants and a large selection of tarts and macaroons. Would recommend definitely, but not if you have a tree nut or gluten allergy. The options are very limited for the tree nuts as most of the dessert options have almonds in them. The food is delicious. Go there for a splurge. Unique and wonderful layout.
Had coffee and an almond croissant from here this morning. Quick service, fair prices, delicious food - can easily recommend! Check them out.

(Translated by Google) I did not see a variety of desserts, I do not know if it is due to lack of raw material or personnel  (Original) No  vi variedad de postres, no se si es por falta de materia prima o de personal
It doesn't matter when you come, there is nothing. They only make a few options at this location. Never again.
First time visiting this specific location. Nice outdoor covered space.

They were out of about 75% of their Bakery items by 1:00pm on a Sunday. Their explanation was "we no longer have a baker at this location so this is all we can offer". The sandwiches we ordered were great, the $50 cake we pre-ordered and picked up was not. It looked fantastic until we cut into it, and then the whole thing started crumbling to pieces. The "buttercream" frosting was weird and cracked into pieces when we tried to cut it. We had a baker in the family that said they must have made the cake earlier in the week and frozen it (not surprising since they don't have a baker anymore). Not what I'd expect for $50. We won't be back to this location; hopefully they haven't let their other location fall apart like this one.

We love the pastries and the coffee. We also had sandwiches there, and I had a croque monsieur. My sandwich was on a croissant, which was new to me and it was pretty good.  UPDATE: Today the croque messieurs were not as good as before and the service was slow.

If you're looking for a nice customer service experience DON'T GO TO THIS LOCATION! I was so hyped to visit this Amelie's and came in (most tables were dirty with previous customers plates and drinks - see photos) also I got an iced coffee and three desserts. The iced coffee was watered down filled with milk and sugar. I asked to exchange with hot coffee and they refused. How cheap can you be to refuse to exchange a cup or hot tea? And they give you a look like you're stealing from them! Ugh I just left this horrible customer service experience place for a so many different ones. Save your self the trip and check out Night swim coffee or Not Just Coffee or Undercurrent Coffee or summit coffee. There's so many places to try in the Charlotte area

I just edited my review because of the response I have just received. I have been to the Amalie's on 36th many times and I love the brie bacon fig jam on halved french bread. I mean I adored and it has thick slices of brie on about a 6‚Äù slice of bread. BUT I just had it here at the Carmel rd location and it was a 4‚Äù slice of bread with jam and bacon. I took it back up and told them that it had no brie and they told me it was a brie spread which equals no brie. Very disappointed
Years ago I used to go to the Amelie's and NoDa and study and take my daughter and she would do her homework and it just brought back so many memories to the one on Pineville Matthews Road the best

I've always enjoyed this location but the quality of service has dwindled. I came around 10 am thinking that there would be no problem dealing with the desserts being sold out. When I got there , there was barely anything in the actual coolers and the lady said that she didn't know when there will be. It's very unprofessional especially for it to be so early in the day on a week day. Very disappointed.

The service at this location is OK. The food is consistent with the other locations. However, it can get crowded which slows down things a bit. They run out of things quickly but they don't tell you until after you've paid & the manager  (short man) isn't very accommodating because of this issue...
If you're looking for a great place to enjoy coffee, great food and service - Amelie's is the best.
Relaxed atmosphere, spacious indoor and patio seating. Berry salad and chicken salad croissant was delish and fresh macaroons.
Very good lunch and of course the macaroons were DELICIOUS !!!!!!
One of the Best coffee shops in US!
Great coffee and macaroons!

Bad and rude service‚Ä¶ the gentlemen that attended us was pushy and after a thank you without deserving it? Not even a polite smile out of him. I believe that the service in Charlotte it's getting worse and worse with time. Absolutely no manners and I'm a Latin woman where I saw that the previous customers where treated nicely

Very rude guy attending us, i came with my wife and sister in law, we are hispanic and there where three people in front of us and where treated nicely and polite and as soon as it was our turn, his semblance completely changed and he was rude and pushy‚Ä¶ i wonder why?
The desserts can be better
The flavor of the chicken sandwich I ordered was great but the chicken was a bit dry and tough.  Didn't seem super busy yet takes longer than expected to receive your order.
Perfect, but get there esrly
Not that big siting as the NODA one or the downtown Amelies. But, the owner looks to be friendly and their is no difference in taste compared to other two locations. Love their macrons

Never have I seen such a display of absolute incompetence than at Amelie's.  20+ minutes and I finally had to ask for a refund, because my food was no where in sight.  5-6 employees and 1 other customer besides myself and these nit-wits couldn't figure out how to put a bacon, egg & cheese sandwich together in under 20 freakin minutes.  No apology, no remorse, just failure.

I've always liked this Amelie's uptown and this location. We ordered macaroons,  almond cake thing, coconut macaroons as well. I liked em but they did taste a bit dry from the inside. I liked the assorted chandeliers and the decor of this French bakery. They make stuff in house.
Great place for bakery items and coffee. Very cute decor and excellent service! Highly recommended
Just don't go on a Monday because there wasn't that much of a selection of baked goodies. Maybe next time!
Extremely slow service, two drinks took 25 minutes to make, food came out wrong.
Always friendly staff and tasty treats!
A super cute lunch and coffee bakery. They are always busy but the service never falls below exceptional. ‚òïÔ∏è

French bakery.   Try the Breakfast sandwich.  Edit:  I have to change my review.  I was in today and after 25 minutes I asked them to check into my order. After 35 minutes they brought me the wrong order.  After 45 minutes they said they would refund the sandwich and bring it anyway.  After 55 minutes I walked across the parking lot and ate at McDonalds.  They never credited a refund so I reported the transaction  to my Apple credit card.   Apple was the only one with good service today. :)
Great pastries and sandwiches
Definitely a good spot for a coffee and pastries.
Very nice.  Great pastries and cookies
So warmth service and great staff! Pastries (especially Almond Croissant) and Hot Chocolate are great!!
Bakeries are so good, sweet enough to enlighten the taste and moods but took forever for just a bread & coffee.
Cool atmosphere and delicious everything.

While my order was to-go, they were kind and gentle. The cafe macotter was delicious and the macarons are the perfect amount of sweet and flavor. There's a cute sitting area outside which I will for sure visit when the weather and covid permits.
delicious food, accommodating menu, and beautiful/clean interior! lovely quirky place

Unique style and very European feel if you want to have your pastry and stay.  Wide variety of options and nice prices. Maybe too much space devoted for seating that is not used at the moment but overall a nice experience.
They gave me a burnt croissant i didnt ask for. Completely wrong order after waiting 20 mins for a to go.
Terrific customer service.  Excellent selection.  Wonderful atmosphere.  Very clean and well stocked.
Excellent food

I know the food is good, but today they got me sitting here 30 minutes to get my food as I watch person after person leave that came way after me. Service isn't very good today with absolutely no explanation.
Great.
Excellent choices, exceptional menu and good service.

Lately they often do not have basic meats available for sandwiches like turkey or ham which is very strange.  It will be 12:30 and no deli meat ??  Go to a grocery store! Usually their food is great but the past month I have had to leave with nothing.
Great bakery. petit gateaux are not petit. I hope they know Oh La La means oh no
The chicken salad croissant was ok. The sticky bun was delish! Service was good.
Excellent pastries and drinks
Love love love this place. Clean, staff is friendly and well versed in the menu and daily items, and they get stuff out in a timely fashion. I love this cafe and bring friends and family regularly!
Best Coffee and Pastry shop South side of Charlotte.
I ordered a breakfast sandwich and they left the egg off, and added the bare minimum of onion and cheese. Total joke

I'm a longtime Amelie's customer. I've been supporting them since 2005 or so. My favorite things to get are: - macarons - salted caramel brownies - apple turnovers - cinnamon twists - breakfast sandwich on a croissant - fig, bacon, brie open-faced sandwich - quiche of the day - chai lattes - the seasonal lemonade
Always a great place for some French food and to hang out with friends! Top notch pastries. You can't beat their flakey and buttery croissants
Nice place,food,dessert,cappuccino very good and delicious. I enjoyed very much üåπ
We work nearby and love grabbing coffee and a pastry at Amelies.  Such a great environment and always friendly staff!

We stopped into Amelie's for a quick stop before going to take out little pup for a walk. The bakery had a large selection with tons of macrons and other classic deserts such as eclairs. I ordered a Napoleon, one of my favorite dessert. I will say that it was hard to cut/eat but the flavor was spot on. They used a more marscapon filling, though I always prefer pastry cream. We also got some croissant sandwiches. The coffee was okay but the cappuccino I ordered was one of the better ones I have had

Delicious and much more than a bakery. They offer a large selection of cakes, cupcakes, cookies, pastries and more. They also offer a very quaint place to sit and have a light bite to eat. Sooo good, no matter what you choose.

My wife, son, and granddaughters went there for breakfast. My son loved the breakfast sandwich. My granddaughters loved the eclairs and the really crisp bacon. My wife and I had the sausage and cheese quiche. I loved it, my wife said hers was just okay, and it was cold
Aways amazing. Am√©lie's is my favorite treat in Charlotte <3
Lumpy macarons with an oily residue in your mouth.
So glad Amelie's has re-opened ‚ù§‚ù§

(Translated by Google) Maybe it was the corona time, so there weren't many people and the menu wasn't full. I want to meet the crowded shops all over the place because the corona situation gets better soon. Then the bread in the showcase will be even more beautiful...  (Original) ÏΩîÎ°úÎÇò ÏãúÍ∏∞Ïó¨ÏÑúÏù∏ÏßÄ ÏÇ¨ÎûåÏù¥ Î≥ÑÎ°úÏóÜÍ≥† Î©îÎâ¥ÎèÑ Í∞ÄÎìùÏ∞®ÏûàÏßÄÎäî ÏïäÏïòÎã§. Îπ®Î¶¨ ÏΩîÎ°úÎÇò ÏÉÅÌô©Ïù¥ Ï¢ãÏïÑÏ†∏ÏÑú Ïó¨Í∏∞Ï†ÄÍ∏∞ Î∂êÎπÑÎäî Í∞ÄÍ≤åÎì§ÏùÑ ÎßåÎÇòÍ≥†Ïã∂Îã§. Í∑∏Îü¨Î©¥ ÏßÑÏó¥Ïû•Ïóê ÎπµÎèÑ ÎçîÏö± ÏïÑÎ¶ÑÎãµÍ≤†ÏßÄ...

I contacted via email requesting information about reopening for in dining but i never received any answer back. Even though mask amd other restrictions have been lifted the store remains closed for in dining. Not convenient at all for customers who have been using Amelie's for long time.  **Thank you for taking the time to reply to my comment.
Fresh, tasty Goodness! Simple as that. Will definitely be returning

I have been loyal to Am√©lies for years and years. Over the last several months, I have had consistently run into issues (wrong order that I can't eat) and attitude that is uncomfortable. I have reached out to customer service to no avail. It saddens me to write this.
Love Amelie's. It's one of our go to places for sandwiches and coffee in Charlotte. Their bakery is amazing!
I stopped in for a little something sweet and I tried the fresh fruit tart, absolutely delicious!  I must say it satisfied my craving !!!!!! Thank You Amelies ‚ù§Ô∏è
They would still not let people sit down or use the bathroom / wash their hands. It's 2021, not 2020.
The strawberry on the top of my dessert was rotten.Dirty patio.
Open outside.
Excellent.
Not as good as it used to be. My drink didn't taste like it had any lavender simple syrup and the macarons left much to be desired.
Came for the coffee, stayed for the macarons.
Good food
This place is amazing!!  I loved the variety of macarons and pastries!  Everything was fresh and delicious.  Me and my friends loved every bit of it!
Great pastries, and chicken salad
Delicate pastries and tasty sandwiches. Received friendly service and loved everything we tried!
Love it!

Had lunch at Pineville today, and it was delicious...Had not eaten at A's in several years and was happy to see the expanded menu...Safety during CoVid is respected ( bravo) ; ate outside at Noon, and the service was great, and the baguette and soup were outstanding! We will definitely come more often...Great job Amalie's !
Great experience.  Pastries were delicious and servers were helpful and friendly
Excellent French bakery with variety of options, which inhibits decision making and challenges you to limit your purchase.  You just must indulge, everything is delicious!  Don't forget the macarons
Always the best
Fast in service and ordered to go. Well pack and fresh. Much enjoyed.
Almond tea cake was greasy.

Tried the breakfast sandwich on a baguette, rather than the typical croissant and loved it! Now I prefer the baguette!  It was lightly toasted, crispy and actually easy to bite into. Substantial and delicious ....and love that you can choose your cheese and other additions.
Dessert and espresso was phenomenal and sitting out on the front patio was very peaceful.

Quirky and fun coffee in a strip mal with Fresh Foods.  Friendly service, lots of bakery and food options, just not really that French. However, still a good place to hang out with friends, currently only outside (April 2021).
Great food and atmosphere. No inside seating yet, but plenty of room outdoor

Three of us went there for lunch.  Crustless quiche was not great, and way overpriced for a very small portion of mostly egg and very little else. Salad was okay,with a tasty homemade dressing.  Asparagus leek soup was very tasty.   Coffee was very good, and bakery items were excellent, but a little pricey.  Staff was helpful and friendly.
Amazing. Fig, bacon and brie...yummy! Also, the chai latte +espresso is heavenly.
Love their desserts! I had their mini-tarts and a cappuccino. Mmm! And they have outdoor seating so you can enjoy it fresh.
Good service, not the best baskery.
Love this place. Treats and drinks are amazing

Without a doubt, pre-pandemic, this place must have been amazing, a go-to place for locals. Love the mini tarts. Great selection of pastries, even late afternoon. Not sure if this is typical, but the employees seemed slightly disaffected or sarcastic. Not sure why. I visited a couple of hours before closing, and the place didn't seem very busy. Still, definitely looking forward to go again.
Delish French bakery, decor, friendly and courteous service, seating available outdoors.
So so yummy. Not as sweet as it looks. I was hesitant but so glad that I bought it. It was perfect. Someone standing in line recommended this to me. Thanks Amelie's
Very good quality, but higher prices. A little lower would be much better, so I'll only visit every now and then.
(Translated by Google) I thought. Had. More sweet variety  (Original) Pense que. Tenia. Mas variedad dulces

Awesome bakery! I really liked the atmosphere. Friendly staff. Great treats and wonderful coffee. We had the macaroons, fruit tart, vanilla eclair and the raspberry lemon tart, cappuccino, and mocha. Great bakery! We will be back.
I ordered a chai latte, but I think I was given an espresso with milk. Very bitter drink. Delicious pastries.
Service has taken a real dive.  Took almost 30 min to get a premade quiche and breakfast sandwiches and 15 min for a cappuccino.  Still no inside seating available üôÑ
Delicious food and great service too!

I miss the large carafe of coffee, seems it's not offered anymore. The fresh brew, lattes, and mochas are enjoyable. Mochas are darker like European versions rather than the typical sweeter American style  The real stars are the fresh pastries. Am√©lie's reminded me why people like macarons (small, colorful French cookie in multiple flavor options) since regular store-bought options are dry and bland. These are fresh and delicious! I also love their coconut macaroons... try both! Unlike the Uptown site, though, the staff wasn't especially friendly today. They also didn't ask light roast vs dark roast and didn't offer cream or sweetener, requiring another wait in the line. They weren't rude, exactly, just distracted I guess. I assume it was just the day since Uptown staff was regularly positive and friendly. Coffee and food were great as usual though.

At 4:40pm the Food was I ordered was not right taste and people work was so mean that exactly place. I don't feel very respect!!!! Never go that place again anymore. I prefer other place the Amelie's was polite manners and perfect order was taste so good!! You will lose the customers because the employee!!!!!!
This is always our go-to for an afterschool treat. Amelie's at all their locations are amazing.
The Amelies bakery follow all CDC guidelines. No dining in at this time. Floor markers in place also directing customers which door to exit out. I enjoy my short visit.

Friendly staff and great food. Nice heaters on the patio to eat there.

Is there an option for 10 stars? Since I was little I've never been as huge a fan of candy as I have been baked goodies. I have NEVER experienced a place where EVERY treat is absolutely ridiculously amazing. I just moved from NY to NC. Out in NY Italian bakeries are all over. This is my first French bakery, and let me just say, you guys makes those Italian bakeries look atrocious. Every time (three times now) I've walked in, just the looks alone of the treats, I can't seem to only get one treat. No, I buy like $50 of treats. As I said I'm not a huge fan of candy, so generally I'm not a huge fan of caramel either. Your caramel bars are insane. PURE INSANITY how delicious they are. That's stating an opinion of something I generally dislike.... if we go to the stuff I DO like... it's like going to heaven. If there is one type of candy I like it's dark chocolate bars. SO, I had your "mirror(?)" dark chocolate and raspberry treat, I LOVE dark chocolate, but I've never seen it used in anything but a standard dark chocolate bar. I actually got emotional eating it, I'm pretty sure I had visions. Thank you for the experience!
Best macaroons in Charlotte!
Great desserts and coffee.
I was so happy to discover this place. Best European style desserts, baguettes, croissants. They are very attentive to safety. There's an outside seating if you choose to take a coffee break

One of my favorite Cafe's and Bakeries. They provide an excellent product and do so with a smile. I have had many meetings at this location and many times just like to stop by and grab a quick latte. There is no way I would go over to a National chain coffee shop when I can go to Amelie's.
Hands down the best bakery in Charlotte. Always find our way over to one of their locations to get a few treats. Can't go wrong with the key lime pie.

Try the salted caramel brownie, you will not be disappointed. I also highly recommend the breakfast sandwiches and the seasonal soups. The asparagus leek soup is my favorite. There is also a variety of specialty coffees. If you like espresso, you should try a cafe fouette. It is strong, so be ye warned. I'm also a big fan of their lavender honey french soda.

Amelie's is always a breakfast and macaroon go to for me. Although I don't get there often, the Pineville location is one of my favorites and I  love the consistency of the original Amelie's eclectic Paris theme.  Offering take-out and outdoor dining only due to COVID-19.

I love Am√©lie's however very disappointed in this visit. Due to COVID-19, the inside dining area is closed which is understandable, but the patio is open. While staff are standing around between customers, they can't take the time to clean off the tables on the patio. I had to ask for someone to come out and clean off a table, only to see afterwards a bucket of disgusting water with a note saying table cleaning is self service. In this pandemic, is this how Am√©lie's values their loyal customers? Needless to say, I won't be coming back for a while. Very disappointed!

Almond croissants here are like heaven. Great coffee. 7/12/20 update What a difference five months makes. Covid19 shut down the interior seating area. Patio open. I ordered $27 worth of food only to find the staff isn't cleaning tables. They aren't even busy as I'm the only person in the place ordering. My wife had to go in and ask for them to clean up a bit. The girl came out, cleaned a single table, rolled her eyes at my wife and went back in to hide in the air conditioning. I see a bucket of dirty water and a sign on it that seems to suggest that customers are expected to clean tables after other customers. No PPE like gloves provided. Seems like a violation of health code even in non-pandemic times. Food is still great, but small comfort when service and cleanliness are so far off.
A must every time we visit Charlotte. Eclectic furnishings with excellent coffee and pastries...

I don't like the way the staff continues talking as if you're not standing there waiting to place an order I've noticed that a lot with African Americans customers. I read a article today in regards to this which confirmed what I've always felt.
Excellent!!

They are always a destination, even for us locals, but I am finding they are a bit overkill on butter. The croissant sandwich I typically order is egg, cheddar, spinach and portabella.   Everything in it and the croissant have been VERY greasy the last two times...and this time they added 2 items I didn't order..tomato and asiago cheese.   (Not to my delight). It took quite a while for our order to get done so I didn't want my husband to have to wait longer. We just don't need that much butter on everything.  We like the decor but it's outside seating only right now.

Great place to sit back and reply to emails/study and have an enticing French baked good.  It can be packed in the evenings; therefore, making it difficult to find seating. Seating is available outdoors.  Highly recommend for students and college stressies who enjoy good teas, French pastries, and day dreaming about summers in France.
Staff was not friendly, coffee was cold. I will not be returning.

I do want to like this place, I really do. But every time I come the coffee is great, but the food is terrible. Today they managed to make quiche inedible, incredibly salty and burnt to a hard shell. I really love the idea of this place, but the reality is always a disappointment.
Great bakery selections. Highly recommend
Its yummy food, treats and teas.... What else you wanna know?

This morning my  husband and I pulled up for curbside service.  We parked in front next to the "curbside service" sign and phoned our order in.  We gave them our our order  (1 iced coffee, one hot chai tea) and they asked if we wanted to add a tip.  Feeling generous, decided to tip 20%.  They said to come inside "in a couple minutes"  to pick up our order.  I politely stated the last time  we were here (which was last week), they brought our coffee out. After all, that is what "curbside service means".  She agreed and said she will bring out our order.  Tipping 20%, I did not think this was unreasonable, especially since we pulled right up to the curb.  We waited 10 minutes in the car and could see no one walk in or out of Amelie's.   We waited another 2 minutes and saw a car pull up and another customer walk inside.  We decided to call them to make sure we get our orders first before these new customers.   We tried to call  and got answering service. My husband decided to walk in and they were not polite to him, saying that they don't do curbside and they never said they were going to bring out our order.   David said his coffee was lukewarm and they did not offer to make him another once due to miscommunication.  We will not be back.  It is a shame that Charlotte lacks good, independent coffee houses.  We don't know of any others locally... I guess we will be going back to Starbucks!
Wonderful food and fun, eclectic decor.
Excellent food.
Placed an order online and picked up curbside, fast friendly service and delicious macaroons as always.
very fancy, maybe a bit overpriced, but expected in this environment. Food is delicious.
Great place Jose knows what he is doing. Great food!

Changing my review to a one star. Had curb pickup and tried calling for 20 straight minutes outside their door with a constant busy phone line. We walked up to the door and waved but the employees literally looked at us and IGNORED us. When we came in the, woman literally said "what are you doing in here" to us. Don't have curbside pickup if no one is paying attention. Good thing you don't want us in your store because we won't be back.
Phenomenal food from breakfast sandwiches Bacon, egg and cheese on fluffy croissant! The delicious salted caramel brownie is my favorite dessert. It's a combination of brownies with homemade caramel.

I love the bakery and their food. The staff could be more polite and patient. I won't generalize it. Some of them are nice but a lot of them dont even have a smile on their face when they talk to  you.
Consistently perfect pastries and coffee.

One of my favorite breakfast places in town.

I love this place! It's huge on the inside, much bigger than I was expecting when I first visited. I like that they have lots of window seating, and the crazy decorations give the place a nice character. The prices are super reasonable and the coffee is good. The have gender neutral bathrooms! Lots of tasty desserts, as well.

Boy boy boy do I love me some Amelie's. Whether it be tea, baked goods, or their wonderful quiches, I absolutely love this place. I've been to two birthday celebrations here and one of them was my own. The aesthetic is excellent and service is always good.  It is a happy place.

I have visited several Amelie's - Pineville, Park Rd Shopping center, and Rock Hill. My most recent experience in Pineville inspired me to write this review. While the food and coffee are generally quite good, the service at this location is terrible. The staff treat you with impatience and impertinence, as if they have more pressing matters at hand. So go for a good pastry, but don't expect respectful treatment!

The decorations and atmosphere are superb, but the food is hit and miss. They are definitely creative with their menu, and the flavor is good. But the texture of some of them falls short. For example the Tartines set on a bread that was a bit greasy. The brownies were very oily and thin. The salad was fantastic, and generous. I loved everything from the bakery case. The sodas are unusual, but spot on with flavor. As I said, hit and miss. But in the end,  I still enjoyed the experience of the visit and will return again. Perhaps just with a different meal in mind.
